section.title: Introduction
section.para: This guide contains information of interest to developers working with XIO. It provides reference information for application developers, including APIs, architecture, procedures for using the APIs and code samples.

section.para:

section.title: Debugging
section.para: All standard C debugging techinques apply to debugging XIO applications. Additionally Globus XIO provides users with some additional debugging information. The environment variable GLOBUS_XIO_DEBUG is set debugging information will be written to a file or stdout. The information generate is particularly useful to identify a suspect bug in Globus XIO. GLOBUS_XIO_DEBUG is set in the following way:
The value of level can take on the logical OR of any of the following:

<file name> is a debug output file, if empty stderr will be used by default. If a '#' precedes the filename, the file will be overwritten on each run otherwise the output will be appended to the existing file.

listitem.simpara: The environment variable GLOBUS_LOCATION must be set to a valid Globus 4.0 installation.

Various other environment variables must be set in order to easily use GlobusXIO application. The proper environment can be esstablished by running: source $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus-user-env.sh or source $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus-user-env.csh depending on the shell you are using.
